meanings.definition: A person or machine that harvests crops.
meanings.sent1: The harvesters worked tirelessly in the fields to gather the ripe crops.
meanings.sent2: The farmers relied on the harvesters to collect the wheat before the rain came.
meanings.sent3: The harvesters had a race to see who could gather the most corn in an hour.
meanings.sent4: The harvesters moved through the fields like busy bees, gathering the golden grains.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the harvesters at work echoed across the valley, signaling the bountiful harvest.

meanings.definition: A group of people or machines that harvest crops.
meanings.sent1: The harvesters gathered in the early morning light, ready to start the day's work.
meanings.sent2: The large farm had multiple harvesters working together to bring in the crops efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The harvesters formed a line and did a synchronized dance while harvesting the ripe fruits.
meanings.sent4: The harvesters moved through the fields like a well-oiled machine, each knowing their role.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the harvesters working in unison was a testament to human cooperation and ingenuity.
